greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of phi(-x^2) * psi(x^3) * chi(x^3) in powers of x where phi(), psi(), chi() are Ramanujan theta functions.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion q^(-1/4) * eta(q^2)^2 * eta(q^6)^4 / (eta(q^3)^2 * eta(q^4) * eta(q^12)) in powers of q.
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (144 t)) = 108^(1/2) (t/i) g(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t) and g() is the g.f. for A246650.
mathematica: a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ EllipticTheta[ 4, 0, x^2] QPochhammer[ -x^3, x^6] EllipticTheta[ 2, 0, x^(3/2)] / (2 x^(3/8)), {x, 0, n}];
program: (PARI) {a(n) = my(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(x^2 + A)^2 * eta(x^6 + A)^4 / (eta(x^3 + A)^2 * eta(x^4 + A) * eta(x^12 + A)), n))};
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Jun 04 2015
